Problem:
class CommercialBuilding { int rent; int bill; bool popular_area; int num_tenant(int guests) { this.rent += 50; if(guests > 100 || popular_area) { bill += guests * 2; return guests; } else { return guests / 2; } } void adjust_rent_and_bill(bool economic_crisis) { if(economic_crisis) { rent -= 100; bill += 50; } else { rent += 100; bill -= 20; } }}",

If the number of guests increases significantly, will this directly lead to an increase in rent?
Explanation: An increase in guests indirectly increases rent through the increase in bill when in a popular area or guests exceed 100. This association is inferred because both the number of guests and popularity directly impact the rent by the logic leading to increased rent.
